page.title: 01Ingleton _ General Area
page.content: Ingleton is a small village in Yorkshire between Kirkby Lonsdale and Settle.Ingleton is a pretty village and attracts a lot of tourists.The main two attractions are Ingleborough Hill and The Waterfalls walk. Other attractions include White Scar Caves and the swimming pool but most people come just for the sights and the friendly people there.Ingleton has two schools; the Primary school and the Middle school. Ingleton has no High School,the nearest one is at Settle about half an hour away by bus.There is a community centre in Ingleton which is built on the site of the old railway station. It was built in 1974 and opened by Mrs J.Coulthurst from Gargrave.
